problem_statement:
Noticed critical race conditions when testing the product search feature in an e-commerce React application. QA reported that typing "laptop" quickly sometimes shows results for "lap" instead, or displays results from a previous search term entirely.

Production logs show memory warnings about setState calls on unmounted components occurring 15-20 times per hour during peak traffic. Performance monitoring reveals memory growing from 2MB to 45MB after 50 searches without refresh, indicating a leak. Users report that rapidly clicking "refresh" triggers duplicate API calls and the loading spinner never stops.

The pagination feature has a bug where clicking "next page" sometimes loads page 1 again due to stale closures. React StrictMode causes completely different behavior than production, making debugging difficult. The search functionality must handle high-frequency input changes, cancel in-flight requests cleanly, and maintain predictable state without memory leaks or race conditions.
